p: The majority of participants were women, which is not surprising considering that women are slightly more likely to be concerned about the environment compared to men. 36 In terms of race and ethnicity, Hispanics/Latinos and African Americans are more likely to be alarmed about climate change than Whites, however the majority of participants in this CCHH ECHO were white. 37 This may be reflective of the racial/ethnic distribution of the healthcare field.
